alert.note: Alert for Newberry; Saluda (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 27 at 6:14PM EDT until August 27 at 7:30PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central South Carolina, including the following counties, Newberry and Saluda. * WHEN...Until 815 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 614 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hickory Grove, Scurry Airport, Hollywood Elementary School, Wyses Ferry, Chappells, Circle Fire Station, Riverbend Boat Ramp, Delmar, Chappells Fire Station and Vaughnville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Most flooding deaths occur in vehicles. Never drive through a flooded roadway or around barricades. Turn around, don`t drown.
